fir_text: A man intentionally stabbed his neighbour during an argument, causing his death.
positive_text: Murder — Intentionally causing the death of another person with deliberate intent or knowledge that the act is likely to cause death.
negative_text: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder — Causing death without deliberate intention but with knowledge that the act may result in death.

fir_text: A woman reported being raped by her employer at her residence.
positive_text: Rape — Engaging in sexual intercourse without consent, through coercion, threat, or deceit, violating a woman’s bodily autonomy.
negative_text: Sexual assault — Physical contact without consent with intent to outrage a woman’s modesty but not amounting to rape.

fir_text: A gang of five broke into a jewellery shop and looted valuables at gunpoint.
positive_text: Dacoity — Committing robbery jointly by five or more persons, using violence or threat to steal property.
negative_text: Robbery — Theft or extortion involving immediate use or threat of violence to obtain property.

fir_text: A student was found using a fake degree certificate to secure a government job.
positive_text: Forgery — Creating or altering a document dishonestly with intent to cause damage, support a claim, or commit fraud.
negative_text: Using forged document — Knowingly using a forged document as genuine to deceive or gain unlawful advantage.

fir_text: A person was caught stealing a motorcycle parked outside a mall.
positive_text: Theft — Dishonestly taking movable property from another’s possession without consent with intent to permanently deprive the owner.
negative_text: Theft in dwelling house — Committing theft in any building, tent, or vessel used for human habitation or custody of property.

fir_text: A person fraudulently induced investors to deposit money in a non-existent company.
positive_text: Cheating — Deceiving any person fraudulently or dishonestly to deliver property or perform an act to their disadvantage.
negative_text: Cheating by personation — Impersonating another person to deceive and obtain property or advantage.

fir_text: A woman filed a complaint that her husband’s family harassed her for dowry and abused her physically.
positive_text: Cruelty by husband or relatives — Subjecting a woman to physical or mental cruelty, often for dowry or coercive control.
negative_text: Assault — Intentional infliction of force or threat causing fear or minor injury to another person.

fir_text: A shop owner intentionally set fire to a rival’s warehouse causing major losses.
positive_text: Mischief by fire — Intentionally causing destruction of property by fire or explosive substance.
negative_text: Mischief — Causing damage to another’s property with intent to injure or annoy.

fir_text: A businessman bribed a tax officer to avoid inspection.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification — Accepting illegal monetary or other gratification to show official favour or neglect duty.
negative_text: Abetment by public servant — Aiding or conspiring in commission of an offence while performing official duties.

fir_text: A man hacked into a company’s server and stole confidential client data.
positive_text: Cybercrime — Unauthorized access, theft, or misuse of digital data or systems causing wrongful loss or gain.
negative_text: Cheating — Deceiving another person dishonestly to induce them to part with property or perform an act.

fir_text: A woman was kidnapped by her ex-boyfriend and confined in a remote house.
positive_text: Kidnapping or abduction — Forcibly or deceitfully taking or detaining a person without consent or lawful authority.
negative_text: Kidnapping for ransom — Kidnapping committed to demand payment or other consideration for release.

fir_text: A person intentionally provided false information during a police investigation.
positive_text: Giving false information — Knowingly providing false statements to mislead a public servant or obstruct justice.
negative_text: False evidence — Fabricating or providing false evidence intending to mislead a judicial proceeding.

fir_text: A man was found possessing illegal arms and ammunition without a licence.
positive_text: Possession of illegal arms — Unlawful possession or carrying of weapons without authorization under prescribed law.
negative_text: Unlawful assembly — Being part of a group with intent to commit an offence or disturb public peace.

fir_text: A police constable demanded money to register an FIR for a genuine complaint.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification — Accepting bribe or illegal reward for performing or delaying an official act.
negative_text: Public servant obtaining valuable thing without consideration — Receiving benefits from person concerned in official matters.

fir_text: A factory worker was electrocuted due to unsafe wiring and employer negligence.
positive_text: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder — Causing death without intent but through negligent or reckless act.
negative_text: Causing death by negligence — Causing death by careless or reckless act without intent to kill.

fir_text: A person sent obscene images to a woman online to harass her.
positive_text: Sexual harassment — Making unwanted physical, verbal, or digital advances or obscene gestures toward a woman without consent.
negative_text: Assault or use of criminal force to outrage modesty — Physical contact or force used to insult a woman’s dignity.

fir_text: A mob vandalized government buses during a political protest.
positive_text: Mischief causing damage to public property — Damaging or destroying property belonging to the government or public utility.
negative_text: Mischief — Damaging property of another person with intent to injure or annoy.

fir_text: A relative abetted a young woman to commit suicide by constant humiliation.
positive_text: Abetment of suicide — Instigating or aiding another person to end their own life through harassment or provocation.
negative_text: Cruelty by husband or relatives — Causing mental or physical cruelty but without direct abetment of suicide.

fir_text: A man counterfeited currency notes and circulated them in markets.
positive_text: Counterfeiting currency — Making or using fake currency with intent to deceive or cause economic loss.
negative_text: Possession of counterfeit currency — Possessing forged currency knowing it to be fake.

fir_text: A government employee leaked confidential tender information to a contractor for a bribe.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification — Receiving illegal reward for showing favour in official capacity.
negative_text: Criminal misconduct by public servant — Using position to obtain pecuniary advantage dishonestly.

fir_text: A teenager stole a mobile phone from a passerby on the street.
positive_text: Theft — Dishonestly taking movable property from another’s possession without consent.
negative_text: Robbery — Theft accompanied by or involving use of force or threat.

fir_text: A man trespassed into a house at night to commit theft.
positive_text: House-breaking by night — Unlawful entry into house at night with intent to commit offence or theft.
negative_text: Theft — Dishonestly taking property from another person’s possession without consent.

fir_text: A hacker defrauded online shoppers by creating fake payment links.
positive_text: Cheating — Fraudulently deceiving a person to deliver property or money through digital means.
negative_text: Cybercrime — Unauthorized online act causing wrongful loss or gain through system manipulation.

fir_text: A woman alleged that her neighbour touched her inappropriately in an elevator.
positive_text: Assault to outrage modesty — Physical contact or gesture intended to insult a woman’s dignity or modesty.
negative_text: Sexual harassment — Repeated or unwelcome sexual conduct through words, gestures, or online communication.

fir_text: A person deliberately spread false news causing public panic about a bomb threat.
positive_text: Public mischief — Spreading rumours or false information to cause fear or disturbance of public peace.
negative_text: Giving false information — Making false statement to a public authority with intent to mislead investigation.

fir_text: A person destroyed court evidence to protect an accused friend.
positive_text: Causing disappearance of evidence — Intentionally destroying or concealing evidence to prevent its use in a legal proceeding.
negative_text: False evidence — Creating or presenting fabricated evidence before a court.

fir_text: A group extorted money from shopkeepers by threatening violence.
positive_text: Robbery — Using force or threat of injury to extort or take property from a person’s possession.
negative_text: Dacoity — Robbery committed by five or more persons acting jointly.

fir_text: A man abducted a child from school demanding ransom from the parents.
positive_text: Kidnapping for ransom — Abducting or detaining a person to demand money or benefit for release.
negative_text: Kidnapping — Taking away a person without lawful authority or guardian consent.

fir_text: A person tampered with an electricity meter to reduce recorded consumption.
positive_text: Mischief causing loss — Tampering with property or instruments to cause loss or wrongful gain.
negative_text: Cheating — Deceiving someone dishonestly to induce property delivery or action.

fir_text: A man was found guilty of dowry death after continuous abuse led to his wife’s death.
positive_text: Dowry death — Death of a woman due to cruelty or harassment over dowry demand within seven years of marriage.
negative_text: Cruelty by husband or relatives — Subjecting woman to cruelty without resulting in her death.

fir_text: A security guard wrongfully confined a delivery worker in the basement.
positive_text: Wrongful confinement — Illegally restraining a person in such a manner as to prevent them from moving beyond certain limits.
negative_text: Wrongful restraint — Illegally obstructing a person from proceeding in a direction they have a right to move.

fir_text: A person bribed a railway official to issue a fake ticket refund.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification — Accepting or soliciting bribe to show undue official favour.
negative_text: Criminal misconduct by public servant — Misusing position to gain unlawful advantage.

fir_text: A student intentionally insulted a teacher in class with abusive language.
positive_text: Intentional insult — Using abusive words or gestures intending to provoke breach of peace or public disorder.
negative_text: Criminal intimidation — Threatening another person with injury to cause alarm or compel an act.

fir_text: A person intentionally injured a traffic police officer during duty.
positive_text: Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant — Causing bodily harm to a public servant while performing official duty.
negative_text: Assault — Physical act causing fear or minor injury without severe harm.

fir_text: A contractor used low-quality materials in government housing construction.
positive_text: Mischief — Causing damage to property by deceit or negligence to gain wrongful advantage.
negative_text: Cheating — Deceiving the government to gain monetary or material benefits.

fir_text: A man impersonated a government officer to extort money from citizens.
positive_text: Cheating by personation — Pretending to be someone else to deceive and gain money or property.
negative_text: Cheating — Deceiving without impersonation to induce delivery of property.

fir_text: A person was found using a previously used government revenue stamp to avoid tax.
positive_text: Using government stamp known to have been used — Fraudulently reusing revenue stamp with intent to cause loss to government.
negative_text: Effacing used government stamp — Removing writing or reusing stamp fraudulently to cause financial loss.

fir_text: A group of individuals planned and executed a terrorist act in a crowded area.
positive_text: Terrorist act — Using explosives or weapons to intimidate public or threaten sovereignty and security of India.
negative_text: Unlawful assembly — Gathering of people with intent to commit offence or disturb public peace.

fir_text: A man deliberately caused a bus accident to claim insurance money.
positive_text: Mischief by fire or explosive — Causing damage using explosives or fire to injure or gain unlawful benefit.
negative_text: Culpable homicide — Causing death or injury by act done with reckless disregard for human life.

fir_text: A landlord illegally evicted tenants by using force without due process.
positive_text: Wrongful restraint — Preventing or obstructing a person from moving freely in lawful exercise of their rights.
negative_text: Wrongful confinement — Confining or detaining a person beyond their will within limited boundaries.

fir_text: A driver caused death by negligent driving under the influence of alcohol on a public road.
positive_text: Whoever causes death by doing a rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide shall be punished with imprisonment or fine.
negative_text: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder applies when there is knowledge and intention to cause death.

fir_text: A government employee accepted ₹50,000 bribe for issuing a license quickly.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration in respect of an official act is punishable with imprisonment and fine.
negative_text: Public servant taking gratification to influence another public servant applies when intermediary influence is involved.

fir_text: A hacker gained unauthorized access to bank servers and stole customer credentials.
positive_text: Dishonestly receiving stolen property including digital data or credentials is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Theft involves physically taking movable property, not intangible digital data.

fir_text: A man impersonated as a police officer to extort money from shopkeepers.
positive_text: Cheating by personation is punishable with imprisonment and fine.
negative_text: Taking gratification by public servant applies to actual officials, not impersonators.

fir_text: A husband repeatedly assaulted his wife for dowry demands of ₹5 lakh.
positive_text: Cruelty by husband or relatives to woman is punishable with imprisonment up to three years and fine.
negative_text: Rape provision applies only to sexual assault, not domestic cruelty.

fir_text: A student leaked exam papers online for money.
positive_text: Disclosure of official or confidential information without authorization is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating provision applies to deceitful inducement, not direct information leakage.

fir_text: A man kidnapped a 12-year-old boy for ransom.
positive_text: Kidnapping for ransom is punishable with life imprisonment or rigorous imprisonment.
negative_text: Simple kidnapping applies when intent for ransom is absent.

fir_text: A mob set fire to a religious place during riots.
positive_text: Mischief by fire or explosive substance intending to destroy a place of worship is punishable with life imprisonment.
negative_text: Simple theft relates to movable property, not destruction by fire.

fir_text: A worker deliberately contaminated packaged milk causing public health hazard.
positive_text: Adulteration of food or drink intended for sale is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Negligently selling unwholesome food applies when no deliberate act is proven.

fir_text: A man recorded a woman without consent in a public restroom.
positive_text: Voyeurism, capturing or disseminating images of private act without consent, is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Stalking involves following or contacting repeatedly, not recording private acts.

fir_text: A gang looted cash and gold from a bank van with weapons.
positive_text: Robbery or dacoity committed by five or more persons with deadly weapons is punishable with life imprisonment.
negative_text: Theft involves taking without violence or weapon use.

fir_text: A man forged property documents to sell land not belonging to him.
positive_text: Forgery of valuable security or will is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years.
negative_text: Cheating involves deception but not falsification of documents.

fir_text: A husband abetted his wife to commit suicide due to mental torture.
positive_text: Abetment of suicide is punishable with imprisonment up to ten years.
negative_text: Cruelty to woman addresses continuous harassment, not the act of abetment itself.

fir_text: A teacher molested a 14-year-old girl student in classroom.
positive_text: Sexual assault on woman without consent is punishable with imprisonment not less than ten years.
negative_text: Sexual harassment covers non-physical acts, not assault.

fir_text: A businessman evaded GST by forging invoices worth crores.
positive_text: Forgery of valuable documents including tax invoices is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating provision covers inducement but not forged records.

fir_text: A man trespassed into his neighbour’s house at night with intent to commit theft.
positive_text: House-trespass with intent to commit an offence is punishable.
negative_text: Theft section applies only after property is taken, not mere entry.

fir_text: A contractor dumped industrial waste in a protected forest area.
positive_text: Pollution or environmental damage causing harm to public health is punishable.
negative_text: Adulteration of food/drink applies to consumables, not pollution.

fir_text: A man threatened to release intimate photos of his ex-girlfriend unless paid ₹1 lakh.
positive_text: Criminal intimidation by threat to reputation or property is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating deals with dishonest inducement, not threat or extortion.

fir_text: A politician deliberately spread false information to cause public panic.
positive_text: Disseminating false or alarming news causing public disorder is punishable.
negative_text: Using previously used government stamps deals with fiscal fraud, not misinformation.

fir_text: A doctor performed surgery without consent resulting in serious injury.
positive_text: Causing death or injury by rash or negligent act is punishable.
negative_text: Culpable homicide applies only when death is intended or known likely.

fir_text: A servant stole jewellery from his employer’s locker.
positive_text: Theft by clerk or servant of employer’s property is punishable with enhanced penalties.
negative_text: Robbery involves force or threat, not secret theft.

fir_text: A man caused grievous hurt to his neighbour with an iron rod.
positive_text: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt is punishable with imprisonment up to seven years.
negative_text: Simple hurt applies when injury is not grievous.

fir_text: A group vandalized public buses during protest causing heavy damage.
positive_text: Mischief by fire or explosive substance is punishable with life imprisonment or imprisonment.
negative_text: Criminal trespass applies to unlawful entry, not property damage.

fir_text: A journalist was unlawfully detained by local police without warrant.
positive_text: Wrongful confinement for more than 24 hours is punishable.
negative_text: Wrongful restraint covers prevention of movement, not confinement.

fir_text: A tenant refused to vacate and illegally occupied property despite court order.
positive_text: Criminal trespass after lawful possession ended is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating relates to deceitful inducement, not property occupation.

fir_text: A businessman issued fake currency notes for payment.
positive_text: Counterfeiting currency or bank notes is punishable with life imprisonment or fine.
negative_text: Forgery applies to documents, not currency.

fir_text: A man intentionally spread malicious virus causing banking data loss.
positive_text: Dishonest unauthorized interference with computer resources is punishable.
negative_text: Theft covers tangible movable property only.

fir_text: A father neglected to provide food and shelter to his dependent child.
positive_text: Failure to maintain dependents without reasonable cause is punishable with imprisonment or fine.
negative_text: Cruelty to woman focuses on spousal abuse, not neglect of child.

fir_text: A railway employee tampered with safety signals causing derailment.
positive_text: Endangering safety of persons travelling by railway by tampering with signals is punishable.
negative_text: Negligent act causing death applies when death results, not just endangerment.

fir_text: A person illegally transported arms without license.
positive_text: Possession or transportation of arms without valid license is punishable.
negative_text: Unlawful assembly applies to group activity, not possession of arms.

fir_text: A mob attacked a police station injuring officers.
positive_text: Assaulting public servant to deter from duty is punishable.
negative_text: Criminal intimidation covers threats, not physical assault.

fir_text: A man disclosed identity of a sexual assault victim in media.
positive_text: Publishing identity of sexual offence victim without consent is punishable.
negative_text: Circulating false news applies to misinformation, not victim disclosure.

fir_text: A man bribed a witness to give false testimony.
positive_text: Taking gratification to screen offender or influence testimony is punishable.
negative_text: Taking gratification by public servant relates to official capacity.

fir_text: A student created fake social media profiles to defame a teacher.
positive_text: Criminal intimidation and defamation by electronic means is punishable.
negative_text: Spreading false information causing panic differs from personal defamation.

fir_text: A man unlawfully confined a woman for three days against her will.
positive_text: Wrongful confinement for more than 24 hours is punishable.
negative_text: Kidnapping applies when taken from lawful guardianship, not confinement.

fir_text: A gang snatched a woman’s handbag using a motorcycle.
positive_text: Robbery involving sudden snatching or use of force is punishable.
negative_text: Theft applies without violence.

fir_text: A patient died after fake doctor administered wrong injection.
positive_text: Death caused by rash or negligent act is punishable.
negative_text: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder applies when intention is present.

fir_text: A cyber-café owner failed to report child pornography being circulated.
positive_text: Publishing or transmitting obscene or child pornographic material in electronic form is punishable.
negative_text: Stalking involves repeated contact or following, not publication.

fir_text: A woman intentionally caused miscarriage without medical grounds.
positive_text: Voluntarily causing miscarriage is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Culpable homicide applies when death of a person results, not miscarriage.

fir_text: A trader mixed stone dust in wheat flour and sold it as pure.
positive_text: Adulteration of food intended for sale is punishable.
negative_text: Negligent sale of unwholesome food applies when adulteration is not intentional.

fir_text: A woman was lured abroad on fake promises of a job and trafficked into forced labour.
positive_text: Trafficking of persons for exploitation through deception or coercion is punishable with rigorous imprisonment up to ten years.
negative_text: Kidnapping addresses unlawful removal from guardianship without purpose of exploitation.

fir_text: A police officer tortured an accused in custody causing severe injuries.
positive_text: Custodial torture by public servant is punishable with imprisonment and fine.
negative_text: Voluntarily causing hurt applies to private individuals, not custodial abuse.

fir_text: A political candidate offered money to voters during election campaign.
positive_text: Bribery during election to induce voting or abstention is punishable.
negative_text: Public servant accepting gratification deals with officials, not candidates.

fir_text: A person illegally transported human organs for sale.
positive_text: Trading, transport or sale of human organs without authorization is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Adulteration of food applies to consumables, not organs.

fir_text: A group of extremists planted a bomb at a railway station causing deaths.
positive_text: Terrorist act using explosives to endanger public safety is punishable with life imprisonment or death.
negative_text: Mischief by fire applies to destruction of property, not terrorism.

fir_text: A man circulated fake government orders on social media to cause confusion.
positive_text: Spreading false information or alarming news causing public mischief is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating by personation concerns pretending as another individual, not misinformation.

fir_text: A forest ranger accepted bribe to permit illegal logging.
positive_text: Public servant taking gratification other than legal remuneration is punishable.
negative_text: Taking gratification to conceal an offender differs from accepting bribe for an act.

fir_text: A group smuggled endangered tiger skins across borders.
positive_text: Illegal hunting, trade or transport of wildlife species is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Environmental pollution involves damage to environment, not wildlife trafficking.

fir_text: A builder constructed on government land without permission.
positive_text: Criminal trespass and unlawful possession of government property is punishable.
negative_text: Theft deals with movable property, not immovable encroachment.

fir_text: A fake doctor performed surgeries without qualification or license.
positive_text: Person practicing profession without required qualification is punishable.
negative_text: Negligent act causing death applies to outcome, not unauthorized practice.

fir_text: A man secretly filmed minors changing clothes in a shop’s trial room.
positive_text: Voyeurism, capturing private act images without consent, is punishable.
negative_text: Stalking involves repeated contact, not hidden recording.

fir_text: A public servant intentionally destroyed official records to hide corruption.
positive_text: Forgery or destruction of public records by public servant is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating relates to deception, not document destruction.

fir_text: A driver fled after hitting a pedestrian resulting in death.
positive_text: Causing death by negligent act like rash driving is punishable.
negative_text: Culpable homicide involves intention or knowledge of death.

fir_text: A cybercriminal cloned debit cards of multiple customers to withdraw money.
positive_text: Cheating by electronic impersonation or deception is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Forgery applies to written or digital documents, not deception alone.

fir_text: A husband denied maintenance to his estranged wife despite court order.
positive_text: Failure to maintain dependents without reasonable cause is punishable.
negative_text: Cruelty to woman covers harassment, not neglect of maintenance.

fir_text: A mob attacked police officials during curfew enforcement.
positive_text: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from duty is punishable.
negative_text: Criminal intimidation concerns threats, not physical assault.

fir_text: A teacher demanded sexual favours from student for grades.
positive_text: Sexual harassment involving demand or request for sexual favour is punishable.
negative_text: Sexual assault covers physical acts, not verbal demands.

fir_text: A journalist was arrested for criticizing the government without due process.
positive_text: Wrongful restraint of person exercising lawful profession is punishable.
negative_text: Wrongful confinement covers detention, not restriction of profession.

fir_text: A worker stole classified defense information and sold it to foreign agents.
positive_text: Espionage or communication of state secrets to foreign power is punishable with imprisonment for life.
negative_text: Forgery of documents doesn’t involve state secrets or espionage.

fir_text: A fake passport racket produced hundreds of counterfeit travel documents.
positive_text: Forgery of valuable security, passport, or travel document is punishable.
negative_text: Theft involves physical property, not falsification.

fir_text: A person offered online betting and gambling using fake apps.
positive_text: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property through online gaming is punishable.
negative_text: Generic cheating applies but not specifically online fraud through games.

fir_text: A contractor built a bridge with substandard material causing collapse.
positive_text: Rash or negligent act causing death or injury is punishable.
negative_text: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder requires knowledge of likely death.

fir_text: A man distributed obscene printed pamphlets in public.
positive_text: Publication or circulation of obscene material is punishable.
negative_text: Circulation of false news concerns misinformation, not obscenity.

fir_text: A security guard detained a woman unlawfully for hours inside mall premises.
positive_text: Wrongful confinement beyond 24 hours is punishable.
negative_text: Wrongful restraint restricts movement but not complete confinement.

fir_text: A man deliberately infected others with HIV knowing his condition.
positive_text: Causing death or grievous hurt by negligent or malicious act is punishable.
negative_text: Simple hurt applies for minor injuries, not deliberate disease transmission.

fir_text: A company dumped toxic chemicals into a river harming aquatic life.
positive_text: Pollution causing danger to public health or environment is punishable.
negative_text: Adulteration of food/drink applies to consumables only.

fir_text: A priest performed child marriage in violation of law.
positive_text: Procuration or marriage of minor girl under 18 years is punishable.
negative_text: Kidnapping applies to removal from guardianship, not solemnizing marriage.

fir_text: A gang stole ATM machines using cranes at night.
positive_text: Robbery or dacoity committed with weapons or force is punishable.
negative_text: Theft applies when property is taken secretly without force.

fir_text: A company illegally mined coal in protected reserve area.
positive_text: Causing environmental degradation by unauthorized mining is punishable.
negative_text: Trespass applies to illegal entry, not extraction of minerals.

fir_text: A person used fake Aadhaar card to obtain government subsidy.
positive_text: Cheating by misrepresentation or false identity to obtain benefit is punishable.
negative_text: Forgery covers document falsification, not inducement itself.

fir_text: A doctor refused to treat accident victim leading to death.
positive_text: Rash or negligent omission causing death is punishable.
negative_text: Culpable homicide requires mental intent or knowledge of death.

fir_text: A man posted hate comments targeting a religion on social media.
positive_text: Promoting enmity between groups on grounds of religion is punishable.
negative_text: Circulation of false information covers misinformation, not hate intent.

fir_text: A factory owner employed children below 14 years in hazardous jobs.
positive_text: Employment of children in hazardous occupations is punishable.
negative_text: Neglect to maintain dependents doesn’t apply to child labour.

fir_text: A builder collected advance payments and vanished without starting project.
positive_text: Cheating by inducement to deliver property or money is punishable.
negative_text: Forgery relates to document falsification, not inducement.

fir_text: A driver bribed an officer to avoid challan for drunk driving.
positive_text: Public servant accepting gratification other than legal remuneration is punishable.
negative_text: Screening offender for bribe applies to concealment, not avoidance.

fir_text: A man sold expired medicines relabeled with new expiry dates.
positive_text: Adulteration or sale of unsafe food or drug products is punishable.
negative_text: Forgery of document doesn’t involve sale of adulterated goods.

fir_text: A landlord disconnected water supply to tenant to force eviction.
positive_text: Criminal intimidation or threat to compel action is punishable.
negative_text: Wrongful confinement applies to physical restraint, not utilities.

fir_text: A corporate employee leaked confidential merger documents to competitors.
positive_text: Disclosure of confidential business information without authority is punishable.
negative_text: Cheating applies when inducement occurs, not disclosure.

fir_text: A man abetted a juvenile to commit armed robbery.
positive_text: Abetment of offence by minor is punishable with imprisonment.
negative_text: Robbery applies to direct commission, not abetment.

fir_text: A hacker defaced a government website replacing official data with offensive images.
positive_text: Unauthorized access to computer resources and tampering with data is punishable.
negative_text: Circulation of false news concerns speech, not hacking.
